Question 31.Question: Subscription in advance is treated in the balance sheet as a
Question 31.Explanation: Subscription in advance is an income in advance which is treated as current liability in the balance sheet. Under the accrual basis of accounting, revenues received in advance of being earned are reported as a liability. If they will be earned within one year, they should be listed as a current liability.
